The Company accounts for its acquisitions using the acquisition method of accounting.
The purchase price is attributed to the fair value of the assets acquired and liabilities assumed.
Transaction costs directly attributable to the acquisition are expensed as incurred.
The excess of the purchase price of acquisition over the fair value of the identifiable net assets of the acquiree is recorded as goodwill.
The results of businesses acquired are included in the Company’s consolidated financial statements from the date of acquisition.
When the Company issues stock-based or cash awards to an acquired company’s shareholders, the Company evaluates whether the awards are consideration or compensation for post-acquisition services.
Determining the fair value of assets acquired and liabilities assumed requires management to use significant judgment and estimates.

During the measurement period, which may be up to one year from the acquisition date, the Company may record adjustments to the fair value of these tangible and intangible assets acquired and liabilities assumed.

Income taxes are accounted for using the asset and liability method. Deferred income taxes are provided for temporary differences in recognizing certain income, expense and credit items for financial reporting purposes and tax reporting purposes.
Measured by applying enacted statutory tax rates applicable to the future years.
Recorded when it is determined that it is more-likely-than-not that some portion or all of its deferred tax assets will not be realized.
The functional currency of NextNav's foreign subsidiaries is generally the local currency.
NextNav operates as one operating segment with its Chief Executive Officer making operating decisions.
Leases (Topic 842) requires lessees to recognize lease assets and lease liabilities on the Consolidated Balance Sheet
A liability to make lease payments and a right-of-use asset for the lease term

data.value: Our common stock and warrants have been listed on The Nasdaq Capital Market (“Nasdaq”) under the symbol “NN” and “NNAVW,” respectively.
As of March 27, 2023, there were approximately 77 and 2 holders of record of our common stock and warrants, respectively.
We have never declared or paid, and for the foreseeable future do not expect to declare or pay, cash dividends on our common stock.
We currently intend to retain all of our future earnings, if any, to finance the growth and development of our business.

We have incurred significant losses since inception. We expect to incur losses in the future and may not be able to achieve or maintain profitability, and may need to raise additional capital.

Our limited operating history makes it difficult to evaluate future prospects and the risks and challenges.
Adoption of our new capability may be delayed by customer unfamiliarity.
Our ability to generate revenue depends on users accessing services through customer platforms.
Intense competition in the market could hinder customer acquisition and retention.
Heavy reliance on third parties for operations and timely supply of components.
Our service relies on barometric pressure measurements and 2D location data availability.

Potential risks regarding the access of our services to third-party platforms.
Dependency on infrastructure deployment for service area expansion.
No guarantee of commercial success for TerraPoiNT service.
Uncertainties in government programs affecting revenue.
Related privacy concerns could damage reputation and deter users.

Disruptions or data security incidents could have an adverse effect.

elements.title: Risks Arising from Security Breaches and Regulatory Matters

data.value: Litigation from security breaches may adversely affect business.
Insurance limits may not cover related liabilities.
Dependence on technical expertise and key management personnel.
Challenges to intellectual property rights could adversely affect business.
Risks from strategic transactions that could affect business.
Increased inflation and supply chain pressures may impact results.
Pandemic effects could materially impact business.
Military actions in Ukraine and related geopolitical effects may increase risks.
Dependence on access to radio spectrum for services.
FCC licenses require modifications and approvals that are uncertain.
Shared radio frequencies may cause harmful interference.
LMS licenses subject to renewal and compliance risks.
Risks from targeting government customers including early termination and penalties.
Handling of personal information creates legal obligations.
Subject to export control and economic sanctions laws.
Exposure to global business risks.
Issuing additional shares may dilute existing stockholders.
Principal stockholders have significant control over company matters.
No anticipated cash dividends in the foreseeable future.
An investment in our securities involves a high degree of risk.
We expect to incur losses in the future and may not achieve or maintain profitability.
Our operating expenses have increased significantly since we became a public company.
We expect to meet longer term cash needs through a combination of cash flows and issuance of equity or debt.
Our limited operating history makes it difficult to evaluate future prospects.
Our services require substantial adoption across disparate industries.

elements.title: Risks Related to Technology Adoption and Competition

data.key: Risks related to LTE/5G technology integration
data.value: The evolution of TerraPoiNT technology to utilize LTE/5G signals may not be successful, increasing costs and challenges.
The hybrid architecture for providing resilient PNT service is unproven and may not perform well.
Intense competition from companies offering similar services for free may affect customer acquisition.
Federal regulatory proceedings may impact the market for E911 services.
There is no certainty regarding the ability to attract customers compared to free services offered by competitors.
If the signals from cellular operators cannot be calibrated effectively, performance may not meet customer expectations.
New technologies in development may increase competition and require meeting more stringent accuracy standards.
Competitors often have stronger financial and technical resources, impacting market competitiveness.

elements.title: Risk Factors Related to Distribution, Cloud Dependence, and Infrastructure Expansion

data.value: The distribution and marketing of services are contingent on third-party platforms, particularly mobile application stores. Disruptions in service or changes by providers like AWS could adversely affect business operations.
Reliance on limited key vendors for components and services may lead to operational difficulties if those vendors face problems.
Services are confined to defined network footprints; expansion requires considerable time and financial resources, with no guarantees of success.
Access to certain radio spectrum is necessary for services like TerraPoiNT; lack of access can hinder service expansion.

elements.title: Risk Factors Related to TerraPoiNT Service and Technology

data.value: There is no guarantee that TerraPoiNT service will be widely adopted by commercial or government users.
Competitors may develop and commercialize alternative solutions restraining market capture.
Sales may be limited by foreign countries' preferences for local solutions.
Pending discussions with international partners may not yield operational systems.
Federal and state government procurement cycles may delay revenue realization.
User perception of location data sharing could harm reputation and user adoption.
Technical infrastructure risks from disasters or cyberattacks could disrupt operations.
Insurance may not sufficiently cover costs from disasters or attacks.
Reliance on third-party providers increases vulnerability to risks.
Complexity and size of IT systems raise risks for security breaches.
Sophisticated and organized groups including nation-states, organized crime, and hacktivists.
Phishing, malware, ransomware, denial-of-service, social engineering.
Potential unauthorized access to sensitive information and disruption of operations.
Implementation of systems and safeguards to protect information technology and data.
Increased frequency and sophistication of cyber extortion and ransomware attacks.
Highlighting risk exposure from third-party relationships.
Requirement to notify regulatory authorities and individuals in case of security breaches.
Loss of customer trust and potential negative publicity.
Legal and financial exposure due to security incidents.
Uncertainty regarding enforceability of limitations of liability.

elements.title: Risks Related to Export Control Laws and Geopolitical Factors

data.value: Changes to export control laws may arise from geopolitical events.
Increasing trade tensions with China and Russia may affect supply chain and compliance costs.
Failure to comply with laws could result in liabilities and affect operations.
Changes in regulations may dramatically affect business operations in international markets.
Fluctuations in foreign currency exchange rates could impact business.
Dependency on in-country suppliers may increase risks related to contract performance.
Providing services in unstable countries may risk employee safety.
Global economic conditions may lead to cancellations of orders or payment delays.

elements.title: Concentration of Credit Risk and Supply Chain Challenges

data.value: We deposit our cash with financial institutions, and, at times, such balances may exceed federally insured limits. Management believes the financial institutions that hold our cash and cash equivalents are financially sound and, accordingly, minimal credit risk exists with respect to cash and cash equivalents.

While inflation and supply chain challenges may impact our revenue and cost of services, we believe the effects of inflation and supply chain challenges on our results of operations and financial condition have not been significant to date.

This section discusses forward-looking statements in the annual report, outlining expectations regarding future strategies, financial performance, regulatory approvals, capital expenditures, and the importance of caution in interpreting these statements.

The acquisition of Nestwave has led to the incorporation of internal controls specific to the acquisition.
The company will continue to review internal controls and processes as post-closing integration continues.

elements.title: Regulatory and Legal Risks Related to Data Privacy and Protection

data.value: Failure to comply with U.S. government contracting laws may lead to contract termination and financial liability.
Allows whistleblowers to sue on behalf of the U.S. government.
Non-compliance with privacy laws could impact business operations and financial results.
California Consumer Privacy Act provides rights regarding personal information.
California Privacy Rights Act introduces amendments to CCPA, effective January 1, 2023.
Virginia Consumer Data Protection Act establishes new consumer rights and data assessments.
Subject to rules regarding Customer Proprietary Network Information and location information.
Non-adherence to Payment Card Industry Data Security Standards can result in liability.
Failure to comply with published privacy policies and other documentation may lead to legal action.
Increased operational and compliance costs due to evolving regulations like CCPA, CPRA, and VCDPA.
Business subject to numerous laws including privacy, data security, health care, and export control.
Non-compliance may result in civil penalties, lawsuits, or revocation of necessary licenses.
Compliance required with U.S. export laws, affecting distribution of products and technology.
Critical to obtain necessary licenses or face operational restrictions.
Regulations subject to frequent changes, impacting business operations and compliance costs.
We maintain a distributed workforce with facilities in McLean, Virginia, Sunnyvale, California, Neuilly-sur-Seine, France, Noida, India and Bangalore, India.
Our principle executive office is in McLean, Virginia.
Our corporate offices in Virginia include finance, regulatory and network deployment functions.
Our California facility hosts our technology development functions among other functions.
Our French and Indian location houses a mix of employees and contractors focused on software development and research and development functions.
In the course of our business, we are involved in litigation and legal matters from time to time.
Such matters are subject to many uncertainties and outcomes are not predictable with assurance.
We accrue liabilities for such matters when it is probable that future expenditures will be made and such expenditures can be reasonably estimated.
We do not believe that any such matters, individually or in the aggregate, will have a material adverse effect on our business, financial condition, results of operations, or cash flows.
